title: Early Look at 2021 Toyota RAV4 Plug-In Hybrid
text:
From Car and Driver

Toyota will release a plug-in-hybrid version of its popular RAV4 SUV as a 2021 model.

The company hasn't released powertrain information yet but claims it will be the most powerful RAV4.

A live stream from the floor at the Los Angeles auto show on November 20 will allow readers to see the new model as soon as the wraps are pulled off.

Toyota has released a teaser photo of the upcoming 2021 RAV4 plug-in hybrid that will be shown in more detail at November's Los Angeles auto show. The automaker provided few details to accompany the photo of the plug-in model but said it will be the most powerful RAV4 yet.

If Toyota is planning to use a version of the Prius Prime's powertrain into the RAV4, we're expecting a pair of electric motors, a gasoline engine that runs on the Atkinson cycle, and an all-electric driving range of around 20 to 25 miles. The RAV4 PHEV may also come standard with all-wheel drive like the regular non–plug-in-hybrid model with an electric motor driving the rear wheels.

The plug-in hybrid appears to share much of the styling of the regular RAV4, with blocky wheel wells, a squared-off front grille, and a floating roofline. Toyota's preview picture (above) shows the SUV in a new shade called Supersonic Red.

We'll know more about the future plug-in hybrid, including an estimated on-sale date, when the SUV is officially unveiled on November 20. For plug-in enthusiasts interested in seeing the RAV4 PHEV as soon as the sheet is pulled off, you can watch Toyota's live stream from the show floor.

You Might Also Like
description: Toyota says it will be the most powerful RAV4 to date, and it will make its debut in November at the Los Angeles auto show.
